body:
**Describe the bug**
In a MacOS 15.3 system running the installation script detailed in the [documentation](https://fvm.app/documentation/getting-started/installation) fails.

**To Reproduce**

1. Open "Terminal"
2. Run:
```sh
curl -fsSL https://fvm.app/install.sh | bash
```
3. See failure:
```txt
Detected OS: macos
Detected Architecture: arm64
Installing FVM version 3.2.1.
FVM bin directory already exists. Removing it.
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0
100 2727k  100 2727k    0     0  2287k      0  0:00:01  0:00:01 --:--:-- 2287k
ln: /usr/local/bin/fvm: No such file or directory
error: Failed to create symlink.
```

**Expected behavior**
The command succeeds.

**Logs**
N/A

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS:  MacOs

NOTE IT DOES REQUIRE SUDO PERMISSIONS

jose@recoil:~$ sudo su
[sudo] password for jose: 
root@recoil:/home/jose# curl -fsSL https://fvm.app/install.sh | bash
Detected OS: linux
Detected Architecture: x64
Installing FVM version 3.2.1.
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current

  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0
100 3149k  100 3149k    0     0  7582k      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 7582k
FVM 3.2.1 installed successfully.
root@recoil:/home/jose#

## Workaround

```
curl -fsSL https://fvm.app/install.sh | sudo -E bash
```

## Explaination

`sudo` will elevate privileges to write to `/usr/local/bin` while the `-E` will keep the current user and its environment so the symlink will point to current user's `$HOME/.fvm/flutter/bin/fvm` not somewhere in the `/root` directory.

## Alternatives
After the error, navigate to `/usr/local/bin`, delete the current symlink with
```
sudo rm fvm
```

then create a new one with
```
sudo ln -s $HOME/.fvm_flutter/bin/fvm fvm
```
still broken, why?  Thanks for the work around.

This is already fixed, it was just not released yet. See https://github.com/leoafarias/fvm/pull/792. As a workaround, you could install directly from main:
``` bash
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/leoafarias/fvm/refs/heads/main/scripts/install.sh | bash
```
